request.description:
This request makes call to the root path (home page) of StandupMan.

Official Repository:

*   [https://github.com/standupman/standupman](https://github.com/standupman/standupman)

This request creates a user, and this document is inserted to the collection (table).

Optional Fields:

*   medium_mode
    *   How user wants to receive notification (e.g. reminders) relating to a standup subscribed.
    *   Current supported mode is only slack.
This authenticates a user with the initial username and password set. A JWT token will be generated upon successful login and the token is used to verify user subsequent access.
This request retrieves the list of users from the collection.
This request updates a users' configuration based on the current user's authentication.

This request deletes a user from the collection (table), and any reminders scheduled for the user.

(deleted user is based on the current user's authentication)
This request retrieves the list of standups from the collection.

This request creates a standup, and this document is inserted to the collection (table).

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   **days**
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified will be Mon - Fri**.
        *   Allowed values: `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]`
        *   For example :
            *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   This sends reminder at every week's Mon, Wed, Thur and Sun.
    *   **timeZone**
        *   A timeZone of IANA type is required to set schedule notification time. **This field is only required when** **`schedules`** **field is not empty.**
        *   List of timeZones: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)
        *   For example;
            *   `utc`, `Asia/Singapore`, `America/Chicago`
    *   **schedules**
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no reminders will be scheduled** **for the current standup**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to set a new reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedules" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 9, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule a reminder at 9:45 a.m at the timeZone specified. It will then be converted to UTC.
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}}, {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule a reminder at 10:45 a.m. and 2 p.m at the timeZone specified. It will then be converted to UTC.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "timeZone": "utc",
            "days": [1, 3, 4, 7],
            "schedules": [
                {"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}},
                {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}
            ]
        }
    }
}

```

item.name: Create new standup with reminders options

request.description:
This request creates a standup, and this document is inserted to the collection (table).

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   **days**
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in "standup" body. **By default** **not specified will be Mon - Fri**.
        *   Allowed values: `[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7]`
        *   For example :
            *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
            *   This sends reminder at every week's Mon, Wed, Thur and Sun.
    *   **timeZone**
        *   A timeZone of IANA type is required to set schedule notification time. **This field is only required when** **`schedules`** **field is not empty.**
        *   List of timeZones: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)
        *   For example;
            *   `utc`, `Asia/Singapore`, `America/Chicago`
    *   **schedules**
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. **By default** **not specified means no reminders will be scheduled** **for the current standup**.
        *   Passing in the form of `{"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": , "min": }}]}` means to set a new reminder.
        *   Params:
            *   "schedules" -
                *   "hour" - number, `0 - 23`
                *   "min" - number, `0 - 59`
        *   For example;
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 9, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule a reminder at 9:45 a.m at the timeZone specified. It will then be converted to UTC.
            *   `"reminders": {"schedules": [{"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}}, {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}]}`
                *   This specifies to schedule a reminder at 10:45 a.m. and 2 p.m at the timeZone specified. It will then be converted to UTC.

``` json
{
    "standup": {
        ...
        "reminders": {
            "timeZone": "utc",
            "days": [1, 3, 4, 7],
            "schedules": [
                {"time": {"hour": 10, "min": 45}},
                {"time": {"hour": 14, "min": 45}}
            ]
        }
    }
}

```

item.name: Update Standup with no additional options

request.description:
This request updates a particular standup by replacing the whole document with the request body specified.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   **days**
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in the request body. **By default** **not specified means it will be updated to the existing value**.
        *   For example:
            *   If current standup has these days:
                *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
                *   **To retain existing days:**
                    *   Do not need set the "days" field in the current update if **"reminders" field** is not specified. Otherwise if **"reminders" field** is specified set it as the example below;
                        *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
                *   **To remove existing days:**
                    *   To not set any days, set it to `"days": []`.
    *   **timeZone**
        *   A timeZone of IANA type is required to set schedule notification time. **This field is only required when** **`schedules`** **field is not empty.**
        *   List of timeZones: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)
        *   For example;
            *   `utc`, `Asia/Singapore`, `America/Chicago`
    *   **schedules**
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. This is specified in the "reminders" field in the request body. **By default** **not specified means if there is current reminders scheduled it will retain the current reminders schedules.**
        *   For example;
            *   If the current standup has these schedules:
                *   `"schedules"`: \[`{..., "time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}, {..., "time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}`\]
            *   **To retain all current schedules:**
                *   Do not need set the "schedules" field in the current update if **"reminders" field** is not specified. Otherwise if **"reminders" field** is specified set it as the example below;
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`, `{"time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}`\]
            *   **To retain only specific schedule:**
                *   For instance to only retain the reminder schedule occurring at 4:45 a.m.
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`\]
                        *   This will only keep the schedule occurring at 4:45 a.m. and not the scheduled time occurring at 5:45 a.m.
            *   **To add new schedules:**
                *   At any point in time the "schedules" field can only hold up to 3 schedules objects
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 6, "min": 45 }}`\]
                        *   Specifying as above will create a new reminder scheduled at 6:45 a.m. and remove both schedules occurring at 4:45 a.m. and 5:45 a.m.
                    *   "schedules": \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`, `{"time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}, {"time": { "hour": 6, "min": 45}}`\]
                        *   To retain current existing reminder schedules and add new reminder, all must be specified.
            *   To remove existing schedules:
                *   To not set any schedules, set it to `"schedules": []`.

This request updates a particular standup by replacing the whole document with the request body specified.

**Optional fields:**

*   **In "standup" body, "reminders" field;**
    *   **days**
        *   The days in the week to send out reminders. This is specified in the "reminders" field in the request body. **By default** **not specified means it will be updated to the existing value**.
        *   For example:
            *   If current standup has these days:
                *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
                *   **To retain existing days:**
                    *   Do not need set the "days" field in the current update if **"reminders" field** is not specified. Otherwise if **"reminders" field** is specified set it as the example below;
                        *   `"days": [1, 3, 4, 7]`
                *   **To remove existing days:**
                    *   To not set any days, set it to `"days": []`.
    *   **timeZone**
        *   A timeZone of IANA type is required to set schedule notification time. **This field is only required when** **`schedules`** **field is not empty.**
        *   List of timeZones: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones)
        *   For example;
            *   `utc`, `Asia/Singapore`, `America/Chicago`
    *   **schedules**
        *   Only up to 3 reminders can be scheduled per standup. This is specified in the "reminders" field in the request body. **By default** **not specified means if there is current reminders scheduled it will retain the current reminders schedules.**
        *   For example;
            *   If the current standup has these schedules:
                *   `"schedules"`: \[`{..., "time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}, {..., "time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}`\]
            *   **To retain all current schedules:**
                *   Do not need set the "schedules" field in the current update if **"reminders" field** is not specified. Otherwise if **"reminders" field** is specified set it as the example below;
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`, `{"time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}`\]
            *   **To retain only specific schedule:**
                *   For instance to only retain the reminder schedule occurring at 4:45 a.m.
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`\]
                        *   This will only keep the schedule occurring at 4:45 a.m. and not the scheduled time occurring at 5:45 a.m.
            *   **To add new schedules:**
                *   At any point in time the "schedules" field can only hold up to 3 schedules objects
                *   Example:
                    *   `"schedules"`: \[`{"time": { "hour": 6, "min": 45 }}`\]
                        *   Specifying as above will create a new reminder scheduled at 6:45 a.m. and remove both schedules occurring at 4:45 a.m. and 5:45 a.m.
                    *   "schedules": \[`{"time": { "hour": 4, "min": 45 }}`, `{"time": { "hour": 5, "min": 45 }}, {"time": { "hour": 6, "min": 45}}`\]
                        *   To retain current existing reminder schedules and add new reminder, all must be specified.
            *   To remove existing schedules:
                *   To not set any schedules, set it to `"schedules": []`.

This request deletes a standup from the collection (table).

If there is any existing users associated with this standup, it will be removed from their list of "standups" field.

This request updates the user "standups" particular field to contain the standup_id specified.

If the standup user subscribed to contains reminders, it will schedule the reminder for the user.

This request updates the user "standups" particular field to remove the standup_id specified.

If the standup user subscribed to contains reminders, it will remove the reminder that is scheduled for the user.
This request post to record the standup notes for a particular standup.
This request gets the list of standup related to a particular user.
This request gets the list of standup responses from the collection.
